description: Level 1: 1 operation, max 2 premises - Mix of direct symbols and word analysis

problems.solution: Apply Disjunctive Syllogism: from "Q ∨ R" and "¬Q", conclude "R".
Apply Commutativity to reorder the conjuncts: "P ∧ Q" is equivalent to "(Q ∧ P)".

natural_language_premises: It is not the case that both the team won (P) and lost (Q).
problems.natural_language_conclusion: Either the team did not win or did not lose (¬P ∨ ¬Q).
problems.description: De Morgan's Law with natural language
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Team won', Q = 'Team lost'. Apply De Morgan's Law: ¬(P ∧ Q) becomes ¬P ∨ ¬Q.
interpretation_hints: 'Not both' means at least one is false
This is equivalent to saying 'not one or not the other'
